N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1160.13 - Hotel/motel courtesy vehicles

State Regulations
(a) General system. Hotel/motel courtesy
vehicles under access permit with the NFTA shall be operated from
loading/unloading areas as designated by the airport manager. The hotel/motel
courtesy vehicle operators are provided the nonexclusive privilege to
load/unload passengers made in connection to passengers' hotel/motel
accommodations at the lodging facility. The hotel/motel courtesy vehicle
operators may cause a direct line telephone service to be installed between its
business establishment, and the airport and pay the appropriate charges, it may
indicate the location of said telephone service in the terminal buildings by an
appropriate sign or signs. (b) Rules
applicable to hotel/motel courtesy vehicles. (1)

Vehicle appearance and running condition. All vehicles shall be kept clean and in first class running
condition. (2)

Cruising. Cruising
on the airport property is prohibited. (3)

Unauthorized parking. Drivers of
hotel/motel courtesy vehicles shall not park in areas other than public parking
areas, unless otherwise authorized by the NFTA. (4)

Solicitation. Hotel/motel courtesy
vehicle operators, or any driver or employee of such operators, shall not
engage in solicitation at the airport or in any way collaborate with or
encourage any other person to solicit business at the airport on such
operator's behalf. (5)

Improper
conduct. Drivers, or employees of concessionaire shall not engage in boisterous
conversations, profanity, or fighting at the airport, nor shall they provide
misleading information concerning other ground transportation
services. (6)

Vehicle requirements. Each vehicle shall at all times meet all requirements imposed by the New York

State Departments of Transportation and Motor Vehicles, in addition to all
other applicable State, city and other local ordinances. (c) Fees and charges. As set forth in the
airport tariff as approved by the NFTA Board of

Commissioners. Notes
